intro: Hemitelia horridipes, commonly known as the rough-hairy hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
